reviews.text: This hotel has a very authentic colonial look, even as it is not nearly as old as to have stood in that time. To make a long story short: this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The building and surroundings are great, the rooms are very good, the service however is their biggest asset: it is out of this world. Everybody is so friendly, attentive and willing to serve, this is great. Trident is at the top off my list if I ever have an opportunity to stay here (or elsewhere) again.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at The Trident in Udaipur on 13th and 14th of Feb. 2013. The experience of stay in this hotel was just fabulous all around. The staff pampered us. The whole facility was nice and clean. If I had to rate this hotel then I would rate it at seven stars plus one! The whole staff from Manager,reception,restaurant,cleaning staff etc. were all very well trained. We do not get this type of welcome and service in USA. Keep up the service and thank you for a memorable stay.
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Udaiput

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ashvin & Suwarna Patel
reviews.title: Amazing hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here during an escorted tour of India. Sometimes tour packages can include disappointing hotels. This was quite the opposite; it greatly exceeded my expectations. It is a beautiful facility with lovely grounds and a very attentive and accommodating staff. The rooms are spacious and nicely appointed. There is only one restaurant but the food is quite good and the waitstaff is extremely well trained-- very outgoing and efficient. Since the same staff is there all day every day, they soon begin to know you. On our last day, our server surprised us with a chocolate dessert where he wrote "Happy Journeys" in syrup below the treat!
reviews.title: Best all-around hotel experience

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Trident both in Udaipur and Jaipur (and had dinner at the Trident in Agra), and were extremely impressed by the overall quality (not just quality-for-price, although that as well) of the rooms, food, services and general management. The staffs were friendlier than at any other of our Indian hotels (including Taj Vivanta ones). Although we didn't stay at any Oberoi hotels (out of our price range), the Tridents are owned and run by Oberoi and are excellent. Food was good -- we ate breakfasts and à la carte lunches and dinners (we don't 'do' the buffet), and were very pleased (although the Udiapur Trident wins our India prize for best vegetable biryani!). I inquired as to why the staff (virtually every single employee!) was so excellent, and apparently they have their own Oberoi training program. In any case, we couldn't be happier with our experience. The rooms at the Udaipur and Jaipur Tridents were identical -- so they clearly have their "style" -- and yet they provided everything one would want and expect. Highly recommend this chain in general!
reviews.title: Unexpectedly personal service all around!
Heavenly experience
reviews.text: My wife and I had a lovely experience for two nights we stayed here. The staff went out of the way to see to our comfort and enjoyment. Food was great and service par excellence. Great value for the money. Will return without hesitation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had one of the most fantastic hoilday with my wife at Trident Udaipur. The best thing we liked their was the attitude of their staff and the highest standards of hospitality to make their guests feel comfortable. Even though it is a business hotel of Oberoi Group (which frankly just means reasonable fares without compromising on anything else that you may expect in a five star) the standards of ensuring guests satisfaction are extremely high and they dont mind going extra mile(s) for that. We were there for our romantic holiday and the staff happily arranged a special table for us by the pool to ensure a private romantic dinner for us - not only that Chef Kamal himself came to see that we are having a good time! He also made rajasthani kachoris specially for us next day for breakfast because I asked them why dont they keep some local dishes for breakfast - and they were the best kachoris I had ever had! Saahil is another gem in his team there who manages to serve all guests as if they are the only guests in the restaurant :)
reviews.title: Trident Udaipur - Every guest is a king!

reviews.text: There are couple of other advantages of Trident:
reviews.title: Luxurious and heritage experience with very minor issues !

reviews.text: (i) While you stay there and pay Trident rates, you have access to some of the facilities of the Oberoi Udaivilas (Oberoi's super luxory hotel) and can even ask for a show around for the property which is an architectural marvel in itself and Trident staff happily arranges for a show around :) We used Udai Vilas's Spa and it was heavenly experience!
reviews.title: Trident Rocks!

reviews.text: (ii) Not only are they by the Lake Pichola (though no views), they have lush green well manicured gardens which none of the other hotels of its categories around Lake Pichola have.
reviews.title: By far and away the best hotel I've ever stayed at
A small paradise
reviews.text: What a pleasure to get lost in the vast gardens of this hotel after some noisy nights in Delhi.

The hotel has only two floors so you should have garden in front of your window wherever you are. But this also means that you may need to take long corridor walks till you reach reception / restaurant, so be ready for it.
reviews.title: A holiday where one feels you don’t know them but know them- friendly, warm & courteous staff – Hotel Trident Udaipur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Garden is full of singing birds, you can see parrots passing by. In the bigger garden there is a fountain, it is really a place for early morning stretching, yoga or meditation. The garden in front of the restaurant has a big swimming pool and children playground. Unfortunatelly, if you like to swim at breakfast or dinner time, you will have the restaurant audience following your exploits.
reviews.title: Another wonderful place
Should be better - front desk needs major changes
reviews.text: The restaurant has an internal and external part and it is lovely to have your breakfast on the terrace if the temperature allows it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are pretty old fashioned but correct, the bed is very comfortable, WiFi (paid) works well in the room, bathroom was rather small but cosy and well equipped.
reviews.title: This hotel is beautiful....shame about the service

reviews.text: This was my first visit to Udaipur and I was completely satisfied with the experience at Trident. The hotel is beautiful and a treat to stay in. The grounds are amazing and one can spend a lot of time walking around the hotel without getting bored. The hotel also has a boat ride in the evenings and that is an absolute must. Besides the hotel , the other thing that stands out is the exceptional service level provided by the staff here. I think all the staff ensure that you have a great time at the hotel right from the front desk to the staff at the breakfast buffet and the room service team . I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A memorable experience

reviews.text: I had the most wonderful time here. The customer service is excellent. I was the only vegetarian in our tour group and the chef took extra special care to fix many wonderful dishes for me. In fact he made a special Rajasthani thali for me with dhal Bhati and churma. Amazing service. We could walk to pichola lake from here and I must say it is a great experience.
reviews.title: Wonderful property
Peaceful comfort
reviews.text: Stayed in a few trident hotels in India and all good. This was the best and in a great setting with gardens and swimming pool which was heated to a good temp for swimming. Good restaurant with excellent choice of dishes. Bedrooms well appointed and well trained staff. A haven.
This is a great 5 star hotel!
reviews.title: Very Nice hotel...
Guest is a god
reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights in January 2013.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Trident has lovely grounds, a great view, a generous pool, and comfortable beds. But beyond all that, the staff are friendly, attentive, and pro-active (without the awkward solicitousness seen at other hotels). Particular thanks to: the front desk greeters, the bartender, Yehaya (the energetic and genial headwaiter), and especially, the chef! When the chef got word that we were disappointed with a few items in the buffet, he came out, asked for feedback, discussed recipes, and - the following night - made us a meal of special Rajasthani bread, the most succulent lamb and curd kebabs, and the best home made saffron and rose kulfi any of us had ever tasted. I'd return there just for the people.
reviews.title: Great !
